function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Simulating the effects of social-distancing interventions and other control measures may lead to inaccurate or flawed predictions of real-world outcomes.","Impact":"Misguided decisions and policies, contributing to the spread of contagious diseases and economic instability.","Mitigation":"Validation and calibration of the simulation model against real-world data, continuous refinement of the model based on new information and research.","Technologies":"Agent-based modeling software with advanced validation and calibration features, access to real-time data for model refinement.","People":"Policy-makers, health authorities, researchers, and the general public.","Owner":"Researchers, model developers, and data scientists."},{"Description":"Modeling the economy within the agent-based model may introduce biases or oversimplifications that impact the accuracy of economic impact estimations.","Impact":"Inaccurate economic impact assessments leading to misguided policymaking and resource allocation.","Mitigation":"Collaboration with economists and financial experts, validation of economic model against real-world economic data, sensitivity analysis of the economic model.","Technologies":"Integration of economic modeling software, access to real-time economic data for validation and calibration.","People":"Economists, financial experts, policy-makers, and the general public.","Owner":"Economists, model developers, and data scientists."},{"Description":"Reliance on a specific programming language and package for the agent-based model may limit accessibility and collaboration, leading to a lack of diverse perspectives and expertise in the development and validation process.","Impact":"Limited innovation and robustness of the model, potential oversight of critical factors and variables.","Mitigation":"Open-sourcing the model code, fostering collaboration with experts from diverse programming backgrounds, continuous peer review and validation of the model code.","Technologies":"Open-source agent-based modeling platforms, collaboration tools for diverse programming languages, version control systems for collaborative development.","People":"Model developers, data scientists, programmers, and academic research communities.","Owner":"Model developers, academic institutions, and research organizations."}]}
